channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report E-2024040465
item.description:
Report E-2024040465

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 30-gallon metal drum containing CDR7102FCNA Hardner Type 02 damaged by a nail from a pallet. This resulted in an estimated 1-gallon release of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 1’x1’ area. A Contractor cleaned-up the release with oil dry, overpacked the damaged drum, and containerized the pallet for waste disposal. One 85-gallon poly drum of waste was generated. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024040970
item.description:
Report X-2024040970

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-23T15:11:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found when unloading a trailer and QA quickly responded by placing the drum in a tote with gloves, absorbency pads and hazmat bags. DescribePack: The package failed due to pressure on the steel drum causing the fill hole to burst. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Station QA quickly responded and placed steel drum inside of a Hazmat bag and tote and used absorbency pads to clean up the spill.

item.title: Report X-2024040797
item.description:
Report X-2024040797

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was going through the sorters on the mezzanine when it was discovered that the bottom of the package was soaking wet. QA was called, the box was removed from the belt and taken to QA for processing. DescribePack: The center of the plastic top on one of the glass bottles was broken causing the bottle to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was removed from the belt and placed upright to stop the leaking.

item.title: Report X-2024040980
item.description:
Report X-2024040980

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived in Load Area 1 leaking orange paint. The package was placed in the upright position and placed in a hazmat bag lined tote and brought to the QA area for processing. DescribePack: None of the cans had lid clips resulting in them lifting during the shipping process and leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the upright position and placed in a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024040924
item.description:
Report X-2024040924

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to the damage area for further investigation. Upon inspection there was a crack at the bottom of one of the pails which caused internal leakage. Furthermore, there was not enough inner package to provide support and was too much air space for items to move around during transit. DescribePack: There was a half of inch crack located at the bottom of one of the pail. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed a destinated hazmat tote lined with a hazmat plastic bag.

item.title: Report X-2024040822
item.description:
Report X-2024040822

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: CHANDLER
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking its powdery contents. Powder was swept up and placed inside hazmat bag as well as the package containing the hazmat to prevent further spillage. DescribePack: The plastic pail found inside the package was not properly sealed, as well as the package not having any form of inner packing to prevent the pail inside from possibly getting damage in transit. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Package was quickly placed inside hazmat bag to prevent further spillage, and all spilled contents was swept up and place inside hazmat bag as well.

Everything was then placed into a plastic HazMat bag and HazMat tote. Everything was then moved to the QA Repack Station.

item.title: Report X-2024040499
item.description:
Report X-2024040499

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: box was discovered on the unload side leaking on one side. it was placed into a Hazmat bag a brought to QA for inspection and processing DescribePack: The two bottles were heavily dented but were not punctured anywhere. The lids were intact. i believe the bottles had too much pressure on them which forced the fluid out. despite intact lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: i just processed the item when it arrived at QA
